Bottle thanks to Rob! Pours clear brown with a fast effervescing. Aroma is spices, bourbon. Taste is spices, slightly herbal, raisins, bourbon heat, slight oak.

Cloudy reddish with a sort of soda pop head which quickly dissipates. Quite thin on the palate but the taste is marvelous: very fruity and smooth from the cherries fading to a bit of booziness which suits the bourbon. Drinks a lot better than it looks.

Bottle from Js. Pours a deep brown with a full finger of foam that lingers then dissipates. Bourbon, plum, toffee, bread and marshmallow nose. Good carbonation. Creamy smith, rich bourbon works well. Smooth, vanilla, chocolate. Nice, smooth finish with a lingering bourbon burn.

Medium amber, clear, tall, fixed, peachy head. 
Aromatic, complex nose. 
Full body, smooth texture, flavorful, 
Tart, sweet, faint bitterness. 
Fruity, gooseberry, alcohol flavored, molasses, burned sugar, hints of yeast. 
Elegant c very enjoyable.

Blood tinged with a rusty scent, boozy, chocolate with a whiff of cooked down cherries. A surpring light palate carries intense maple and cherry, faint reminders of yeast and walnuts. Awesome stuff.

35,5cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Helder hazelnootbruin met een beige schuimkraag. G: Rozijnen, kersen, toffee en wat alcohol. S: Zoet. Karamel, gedroogd fruit, kersen, wat esters en alcohol. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

2015 edition. Best before 30/09/2017. Pours a cloudy deep amber colour with a warm cap, decent retention with some mild creamy lacing. Lots of particles of different sizes running through it. Very sweet aromas with many dark fruits (raisins, plums, dates), caramel, toffee, burnt sugars and some spices. The taste is sweet, but not as rich as expected which makes it easier to drink. Still the dark fruits, caramel with some hints of molasses. A slight dry finish. Goes down very easily. A little too rich to have a big bottle though.

Dark ruddy brown pour with a tall, creamy to chunky beige head that has good retention. Aroma of dark fruit, bourbon, cherries, turbinado sugar, fresh baked whole grain bread, light nutty and chocolate notes and some tough to pin down, kinda sharp fruity esters. Flavor is caramel, toffee, bourbon (more woody than anything), and dark sugar up front; then licorice, cooked apples and stone fruit, hay, hints of cocoa nibs, slightly tart, mellow cherries, some spicy, lightly peppery and bready yeast notes round out the finish. Bourbon cherries and stone fruit linger for a while. Heavy body, chewy, but somewhat creamy feel, medium, blanketing and fairly sharp carbonation. I really like this beer, everything just works together. It would be a perfect cold weather sipper with, or without a nice mellow cigar.

Expensive but very good 
Very smooth flavorful 
11.8% so sip slow and enjoy
Purchased at the Celina wine store 05/10/17

Bottle from LCBO.. Caramel, marshmallow, bourbon aroma. Same notes in the taste with some spice. Not all that boozy. Really good.
Taster. Bourbon, caramel, butter, fudge. Sweet, a small sting from alcohol. Very balanced and tasty beer Brown color.
UPDATED: APR 3, 2017 Wonderful dark fruits aroma. Definately some C2H5OH in the aroma and taste. Malty boozy goodness. Go get some, its great. At 11.8% be careful!!

Aroma of Belgian phenols, toffee and plum/raisins. Slight alcohol whiff. Appearance is fairly clear copper with white head and beautiful Belgian lacing. Flavor is dark stone fruit. Plums. Raisins. Dried cherries. Alcohol. Bourbon. 
Mouthfeel - full body, medium high carbonation. Sweetness in the finish. 
Overall an excellent Belgian quad. Very tasty and alcohol hides well behind the malty and yeast flavor.

A four-pack of 12-ounce bottles purchased at Sebastian (Fla.) Discount Beverage while visiting my snowbird parents; FYI, in a virtual interesting-beer wasteland, this small place was a good find. Pours into a snifter a cloudy amber color, leaving behind a small off-white head. Aroma is pretty much as the packaging says it will be: bourbon, wood, vanilla beans. The flavor is more complex; I taste plums, dates, figs, raisins, prunes, cherries, toffee (as it warms, the flavor kicks up -- not surprising). It has a medium body with a creamy mouthfeel. This is a very good Americanized Beligan quad from a consistently good brewery nearly dead-smack in the middle of the U.S.

Tallahassee, Fl - Market Square Liquors - 12 oz bottle. Pours a sparkling medium orange-brown with some lively specks floating about. Aroma has some brown sugar accents, a hint of molasses, light wisps of bourbon. Delicious flavor, some nuttiness permeates throughout, some date-like sweetness, some cherry fruitiness, brown sugar an a wee bit of bourbon, just enough. Smooth, silky mouthfeel. Nice winter warmer on this last grasp of winter in North Florida.

Bottle, sampled in a glass, 
this ale was a dark red in the glass with lots of particles in the glass, and the pour gave an off-white cover one to two fingers high, some bubbles had a very faint yellow hue, it left nice spots and partial rings of lacing on the glass, 

the nose had aromas of bourbon liquor, dark fruit that resembled date and fig, dark bread, some dark candy, malt and sugar sweetness, some liquor alcohol, faint vanilla, some spice white pepper and liquor spice notes, 

the flavors were big bourbon liquor, liquor spice and some alcohol, there was light bread with some date and fig dark fruit, a bit of hard candy, 
a little vanilla, the cherry was in the background, 
and the bourbon liquor alcohol spice gave a bite at the finish that lingered, 

this drink felt sort of light and lively on the lips with all of the carbonation in the beer, the mouth feel was light medium, and it was creamy on the lips, and the bourbon alcohol dried out the tongue a bit, 

the bourbon was out front and on top of everything else, 
the bourbon liquor gave some alcohol burn and bite on the palate, each drink gave a alcohol warmth and dryness on the mouth, 
this drink was a big bourbon liquor beer.

Pours cloudy dark caramel brown with a small beige foam. Aroma is soft, sweet, slight cherry, oak and toffee. Taste is a great balance of fig, sweet cherry with just a touch of tartness, oak and toffee. Heading out tomorrow to look for more.

Brown bottle, 1 pint 9.4 ounces, 2015 vintage, best before 30/09/2017, purchased at the LCBO, savoured on March 3 2017; eye: maroon, hazy, minuscule ring of tan head, some legs, no lacing; nose: fruity, malt, bourbon, Belgian yeast, alcohol, toffee, molasses, slight woody; mouth: fruity, malt, bourbon, Belgian yeast, alcohol, toffee, light molasses, alcohol warmth, fig, slight woody, finale in fig with presence of alcohol, medium-full body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 1 pinte 9,4 onces, millésime 2015, meilleure avant 30/09/2017, achetée à la LCBO, savourée le 3 mars 2017; il : marron, trouble, minuscule anneau de mousse fauve, un peu de jambe, pas de dentelle; nez : fruité, malt, bourbon, levure belge, alcool, toffee, mélasse, très léger boisé; bouche : fruité, malt, bourbon, levure belge, alcool, toffee, léger mélasse, chaleur dalcool, figue, très léger boisé, finale en figue avec présence dalcool, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : bien

Pours a brown color with a white foam head. Aroma is bourbon, caramel, toffee, some cherry, and vanilla. Flavor is sweet caramel and toffee, bourbon, and cherry. Has a thick, smooth, and creamy body. Seems more along the lines of a barleywine than a Quad, since the yeast is not a defining characteristic. Quite good.

(bottle) cloudy, bright orange brown colour with a medium tall brown head; aroma of toffee, brown sugar, spice; rich, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish, well hidden alcohol; thick palate
malty aroma with hints of stone fruit. red in color with huge long lasting head. taste is richly malty with notes of raisin, plum, cherry, faint oak notes
This brew was waaaay too overpowering with the bourbon "notes". I wanted and tried to like it on several occasions but could not finish even one.
Femrented prune like it rained while the plums were drying. Light florals and bourbon well integrated. A hint of citrus. Light sweet finish. Bottle.

Bottle. Pours amber brown with fast-dissipating, off-white head. Aroma muted, notes of yeast and alcohol. Sharp, fruity opening. Plum, cherry. Heavy malt. Some wild yeast character. Carbonation noted immediately. Active mouthfeel. Warming finish. Powerful, flavorful, very enjoyable.

Vintage 2014 Edition. 

This bottled has matured 2 years in Florida since I bought it in February 2015. 

The beer pours hazy and orange-brown with a thin head. No lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Raisin, plum, oak, Bourbon, syrup, grain, vanilla and toffee. 
Taste: Deep and complex. Plum, raisin, brown sugar, Bourbon, vanilla, spices and wood. 
Mouth: Medium to full body. High carbonation. Warming alcohol at the end.
Hazy orange pour with off white head. Aroma is rye and yeast. Taste is rye, roast malt, vanilla, cherry and biurbon. Pretty complex and enjoyable.

Bottle from LCBO. Pours clear orange some frothy head no lacing. Nose is sweet syrup and some rye pepper. Notes of sweet syrup, dark fruit, candi sugar, bourbon vanilla. Taste big sweet medium/light bitter. Full body medium fizzy carbonation, alcohol is well hidden.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 This is now available in a 4-pack of 12 oz bottles. Doesnt say Smokestack Series but the abv and ibu line up to this brew. Pours amber brown with small head and lace in a tulip glass. Aroma of malt, grains, bourbon. Medium carbonation and significant mouthfeel. Flavors of amber malts, caramel, molasses, bourbon, grains, minerals, wet towel. Overall, big, bold...ooh wee!!

Re-rate - From the same 4-pack its 2 months later and the wet towel bite is gone...very smooth and Im upping my ratings.  Modest aging for bigger American beers payed off in this case.

A super new age quad. A dense redish mahogany body with an active off white head. The nose is engaging, with toffee, cherries, dark berries and a touch of citrus hops. Sweet, easy drinking bourbon leads the taste profile. Not harsh at all. Rich toffee, biscuit malt, candied fruit, cherries and a touch of citrus hops create a rich smooth but still lively blend. A hint of sourness and yeast add to the complexity. Barrel aging that is not overdone. Good one.

750ml corked and caged. Dark, hazy brown pour, with a small beige head. Incoming!!!!!!! We have a barrel bomb!!! Whoa, the nose on this is all barrel. Massive notes of Bourbon, wood, vanilla and its very very boozy. As it warms more fruit comes through, but man this is woody, and earthy, and loaded with sweet Bourbon barrel notes. Carb is nice, mouth feel is solid. Finish is slightly astringent, medium butter finish, boozy, and fruit with mkr huge barrel notes..if barrel bombs are your thing this is for you.. This is one of the more barrel forward beers Ive ever tasted. But the base quad is much too lost for my tastes, I can barely tell what the base beer is. Good, not great.
Bottle pours hazy brown with a tan head. Aroma of vanilla, dried fruit, wood and bourbon. Taste is complex with bourbon, toffee and some fruity notes.

Heavy aroma of bourbon and booze. Light notes of cherry and vanilla. Taste follows with oak tannin, raisin, plum. Palate is medium-thick, with a slightly tannic finish and some heat. Overall- quite well done, good balance of flavour. Most bourbon-forward beer I have ever tasted.

12 oz. bottled 11/10/2016. Mostly clear chestnut body has a big spongy foam above. Nose is brown sugar, whiskey, vanilla and orange zest. Tastes of whiskey, toffee, earthy vanilla and plum. A slight peppery tingle that may be citrus zest. Bits of chocolate cherry and oak in the long finish. Medium-heavy body has a nice balance and a pleasant medium carbonation.

Well here is a beer both humble and great - the quad aspect isnt overpowering, and so it supports the bourbon booze and barrel oak very well. Pouring the 2015 bottle into a cheap clear wine glass (who with big hands really needs snifters?) this exudes power and finesse. Figgy dried fruits and fruit cake, bread, caramel corn, just a hit of dry ethanol nothing too harsh. Wow Im drinking this room temp. Good body and light finishing bitterness, maybe slightly cool would be better. * edit * slightly cooled IS better, enhancing the delicate crispness and still showing the vanilla and toffee. Hard time detecting cherry, but its in the structure. This is honestly as good as wines many time the price.

A very fine brew indeed. Makes me wonder if Duvel/Moortgat make anything better in Belgium! Aroma is sweet and fruity, color in bright winter light is ruby red. Yeasty, very fruity with plum and cherries predominating and the alcohol is quite obvious. Good viscous body, great mouthfeel, almost like a heavenly sherry or port. Mildly sweet and very strong, its wonderful to have one but I wouldnt like to follow it with another, however. Excellent brew.

Bottle from LCBO. 2015 vintage. Poured into Trappist glass. Deep foggy red body with a very slight sliver of foam across the surface. Fantastic first sip. Rich toffee, dried dates, brown sugar, green wood. Very interesting use of the barrel. Perhaps the blending avoids some of the pitfalls of bourbon barrel aging. Booze isnt mostly stealthy which is surprising given that its tweaked up to 11.8%. Very worthy.

Pours a cloudy, dark amber color with an off-white head. Aroma is bourbon, oak, lemons, and dark fruits. The bourbon doesnt come as strong on the flavor but still present. Lemon and dark fruits are strong with some warming on the finish.
750ml bottle. Murky copper with a foamy beige head. Flavors are toffee, bourbon, cherry, barley sugar and alcohol with spicy and woodsy notes. Full body, soft to moderate carbonation, oily texture.

Poured from the 750 mL bottle into a trappist style glass to drink. The beer had a pretty cloudy deep amber to brown color with light sediment and a modest foamy-creamy off-white head with average retention and good cling and lacing. Its aroma featured an immediate and strong bourbon barrel scent true to its name, along with some lighter floral hops, a slight touch of barley malt and sugar, and a bit of alcohol. The taste was somewhat sweet and malty, featuring bits of cereal and caramel, but also had a big sour and bitter grain mix with a strong underlying bourbon and oak flavor for a slight whiskey-like effect. It had a strong and filling mouth presence with a lively and fizzy body with high carbonation and a dry effect with a warm alcohol finish. Thank you to my wife Siobhan for the nice present!

Bottle in Seattle. 12oz. Creamy soft foam, tall and lacing. Lovely red-brown, heavy but ultimately fairly clear-edged. Very nice balance in the body, alcohol smooth and hidden and complex flavors filling the palate. Barrel is quite present, and is more notable than the quad base. Light spiced character, some earl gray tea, a touch of cherry acidity. Tea, spice and some alcohol burn on the nose. Barrels vanilla-bourbon character is a smooth undertone to the entire beer. Smooth, filling but never harsh. Very nice.
Funky whiskey aroma. Nice ebony color. Notes of dark fruit, whiskey, and candy. Nice boozy warming finish. Solid.

It pours murky hazelnut brown; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: plums, oak, toffee, citrus-zest, toast, figs, and bubblegum. The taste is medium-heavy sweet that finishes heavy bitter and lightly astringent. The palate is full bodied, had medium carbonation (very soft); the finish is long. Overall, its superb!

trying to love this style and not quite getting there. very complex aroma and taste.. moreso as it warms. aroma of many things - light bourbon, vinous fruits, light caramel maybe. taste was of many things - tartness in addition to the aroma flavors. very light touches all around; esp on the bourbon brrl.

2016/12/08 - Pours a hazy amber brown with lots of suspended particulate and a thin, off white head that quickly dissipates and leaves no lacing. Aroma is oaky vanilla, dark fruits (raisins, cherries), burnt sugar, butterscotch, yeast and bourbon. Taste is oaky vanilla, sweet bourbon, caramel, yeast and hints of dark fruit. Mouthfeel is medium and oily with smooth carbonation and a moderately sweet, lightly warming finish. Being a fan of quads and bourbon barrel aged beers, I really enjoyed this. Just the right amount of bourbon and the ABV is well balanced.
Rust on colour with a thick white head, this beer looks fantastic. I get dark fruits on the nose and a boozy warmth on taste.

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky orangey brown with moderate-sized cream-coloured head. Aroma is big on bourbon, toffee, raisin, candi sugar and some alcohol. Flavour is also huge bourbon, toffee, raisin and other dried dark fruitiness, brown sugar, yeasty spiciness and some booziness. Body is medium to full. Not my style but well done.

750ml bottle from LCBO. 11.8% alc./vol. Pours a hazy deep amber colour with one finger of head that quickly reduces into a spotty film. I get tons of bourbon and toffee on the nose with notes of plums and dark cherries. Wow, what a complex taste. Bourbon back bone with toffee and caramel up front then it fades into a well balanced spicy oak and finishes with an alcohol soaked cherry flavour. Medium-thick bodied with moderate carbonation. Leaves a sticky caramel mouthfeel. If youre a fan of Belgian Quads and Bourbon, then dont even hesitate to try one.

Pours a cloudy caramel color with a very large light tan head. Caramel, dried fruit, vanilla and alcohol on the nose. Tarter and more bitter at the finish than I wouldve expected. Not as rich as I expected either. A lot of oak in the flavor. Fruity mainly, with secondary caramel flavor.

Pours a very cloudy pinkish-orange, lots of sediment and suspended particulates. Good amount of off-white foam, very fine. Aroma is sweet and malty, can also smell the bourbon. Taste is bourbon and tart, with fainter amounts of caramel and malty sweetness. I would have preferred a bit weaker on the bourbon and a bit more of the caramel sweetness, but still pretty good stuff.
12oz bottle. Cloudy caramel copper pour. Strong bourbon barrel aroma, some dark fruits. Some harsh alcohol up front, then sweetness come. Good finish, I like it.
Bottle, 2014 vintage - big foamy head, dark brown color, big Belgian complex aroma and flavor, malty, dark fruits, boozy bourbon, with just some mild cherries in the background, very good overall

2014 bottle, from Triangle Wine Morrisville IIRC. Cork comes out with a loud pop and flies across the kitchen. Good aroma, sweet, malty, oaky. Strong bourbon, not overwhelming though, oak, cherry, big initial head, slowly faded to a foam cover, good lace. Clean brownish orange color. Strong sweet flavor. Full body, oily, creamy texture, soft carbonation, sweet finish. Very nice level of barrel, yet still retaining quad aspects. Getting some yeasty fruitiness as it warms in aroma. Just about perfect level of bourbon.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: A really tasty and smooth quad. I could drink a bunch of these and get in trouble.

Bottle to tulip - Beautiful! Pours a murky amber, scattered suspended particulate. Head is a thick creamy ivory with spots of brown yeast from the pour. Aroma is big, pungent. Tons of whiskey, cherry, oak, some alcohol. Medium bodied, nice carbonation.  Probably the most bourbon-centric beer Ive tasted.... Too much so in my opinion, more woodiness, dark fruits, buried yeast and caramel. Its good, big, but it seems to have been overrun by the booze and phenols.

Poured from bottle use by 9/9/18 copper brown with a fizzy tan head nice lacing and some floaties. Aroma of bread caramel malt fruit and alcohol. Taste is sweet slightly bitter finish bread alcohol and dark fruit.

Pours a hazy copper-brown with a couple fingers of off-white head. Aroma is cherries, bourbon, caramel, dried fruit and a good dose of alcohol. Flavor is sweet with a lot of fruit, especially cherries and pears, molasses, nutmeg, maybe cloves. Some resin in the finish, and then...apple pie? Surprisingly light mouthfeel, with good carbonation. I love this beer. But at 11.8%, one in a session is enough.

From the 12 fl oz bottle. It pours a reddish-amber tone with a small head. Aroma has a definite caramel malt and Bourbon character. The body is medium to full. The taste has a big malt flavor, a fruity note, licorice and some booze.

12oz. bottle from Brewery: This one pours an opaque dark caramel color. There was no head or lacing to it. The nose is good. Some bourbon, candi sugar, malts, dark fruits. The taste is very good. Some bourbon, but not too much. Some sweet malts, vanilla, faint fruits, A really nice quad.

Pours a dark, cloudy brown with a medium-sized beige head; tiny specks of sediment floats in the beer (almost like theyre suspended in a gel). The nose is incredibly oak-forward, easily showing off a blend of bourbon barrels that somewhat take a cognac character. Aromas of butterscotch, candied fruit, fruit syrup, tobacco, toffee, and definitely alcohol. The boozy smell makes me think of young bourbonsmaybe three to six years old. Flavors are initially sweet and malty (cherries & vanilla) and then moves into a bittersweet fruit note (orange cocktail bitters) plus spice. The taste of booze is present throughout but more so in the long finish. Its full-bodied with medium carbonation and really isnt afraid to show off the hot booziness. This is a complex, layered quad that leads with its barrel qualities and makes no effort to hide its strength. Theres no mistaking that this beer is isnt barrel-aged, and you taste every bit of that 11.8%!

Bottle from Julios. Poured into a snifter. A murky deep amber-brown color. Frothy tan head settles to a thin lace. Excellent flavor and aromas of dark cherry, plum, candi sugar, and earthy spice. Very smooth texture. Long bittersweet finish.

Amberkleurig bier met wit schuim. Geur: toffee, brood, rozijnen. Smaak: licht zoet, kandij, rozijn, alcoholisch. Geen kersen opgemerkt. Lichte koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht zoet, wat droog en een vleugje zuur.

12 oz. bottle from Mr. Bs. Looks to be a dark red with some haze in the body and a permanent off-white head. Nice, fruity, spicy aromas from the yeast cut through the vanilla oaken notes. Some hints of chocolate and cherry are here as well. The palate is big and creamy. A tasteful alcohol burn is present. The bourbon isnt crazy in this beer. Cherries really start to come through in the finish, but never come to the foreground. Pretty unique for a barrel aged quad, but I might actually like it even better without fruit.

Hazy copper under a thin light ivory cap. Bright and succulent boozy nose thats woody, caramelly, dates, cherries, brown sugar and light bourbon and raisins. Flavor is a delicious woody and bourbonny raisin bomb with dates and cherries and oak and caramel and a touch of vanilla. Smooth fruity and woody sweet finish with a boozy background.

Pours a deep cloudy amber with a thick creamy long lasting orangish off-white head. Bourbon and old leather aroma. Burnt candy flavor along with a slightly bitter toffee taste, bourbon, vanilla, cherries, aged hardwood and a buttery character. Alcohol is evident in the taste and the warmth after the swallow. Cloyingly sweet, yet smooth and interesting.

Thank you to Nik for this very thoughtful present. Pours a deep and cloudy copper with a thin tan head. The aroma is tart and extremely boozy. Along with plenty of bourbon, there is caramel, cherry, oak, and a little bit of vanilla. The taste is sweet and tart, although the sweetness isnt over the top. This one also doesnt have the bourbon kick that the nose would lead you to believe. I find vanilla, bourbon, cherry, raisin, and caramel. The flavors are well balanced, with probably the bourbon standing out most. This is medium in body, with a sticky texture, and has average carbonation. Despite is strength, I found this one easy to drink. An excellent choice here.

750ml bottle. (2015 release) Pours a cloudy red-brown with lots of sediment floating around and a large, frothy, long lasting, beige head that laces. Sweet, malty aroma of toffee, overripe fruit, bourbon, vanilla, cherry and oak. Sweet flavour of toffee, dried fruit, spice, bourbon, vanilla, cherry and oak with a dry, slightly tart, warming alcohol finish. Medium to full body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Very nice.

12oz bottle. Hazy Amber brown color with particulates and an off white head. Sweet plum alcohol aroma. Sweet cherries toffee dark fruit bourbon finish. Thick chewy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2015 bottle poured into a tulip glass..burgundy with a medium off-white head..
aroma of toffee,bourbon,dark fruits,caramel..tastes of cherries,raisins,bourbon,
toffee & bread..well done.

Big toasted coconut aromas and raisin bread. Taste is yeasty raisin bread, caramel, bourbon, vanilla and some cherries on the finish and after taste. As it warms more caramel, vanilla, and toffee aromas appear; as well as some plum.

Opened a well carbonated bomber of the 2015 release and poured into a snifter glass. Copper in color with plenty of head. Fruit, caramel, and a nice Bourbon smell. Taste is sweet with caramel, vanilla, and dark fruits rounded off by bourbon. Would buy again in a heartbeat at 12.99!

2014 vintage. Cloudy nut brown pour. Dense one-finger head with tight bubbles. Lots of lacing. Wonderful mouthfeel. Very boozy and definitely the first taste is bourbon. Aroma has lots of bourbon. Nutty flavor is definitely present but not much in the vanilla or toffee sweeter flavors.

(Bottle) Reddish brown colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, fruity nose with caramel, dried fruit, rye bread (sour dough bread?), oak wood, bourbon, dried apricots, honey, vanilla and toffee. Malty, fruity taste with notes of caramel, rye bread, bourbon, oak wood, toffee, vanilla, apricots, hints of liquorice (salmiac), dark cherries, raisins and a warming finish with a gentle spicy/earthy bitterness and a certain bourbon glow. Full body, quite sweet. Tasty, warming and complex with a generous bourbon wood character. Excellent beer.
Bottle. Pours a clear reddish brown. Aroma and taste are sweet dark fruits and some bourbon.

Beautiful pour, great mouthfeel, but lacking a touch in the flavor department. Excellent copper pour w/ a retaining white head & good lacing. The aroma is surprisingly light w/ some bourbon coming through. The taste is heavy bourbon w/ the subtleness of the cherries as an undertone. It has a lovely mouthfeel but overall is just a solid beer.

Type: 750-ml. bottle
Glass: Karl Strauss 26th anniversary tulip glass
From: Barons Market in Alpine, Calif. 
Price: $14.99
Purchased: June 18, 2017
Consumed: July 8, 2016
Reviewed as: Quadrupel (Quad)
Misc.: Bottled on Sept. 18, 2015; Best by Sept. 2017; Cork and cage top; Received from Rachel for Fathers Day

Thanks, Rachel!

Definitely a huge fan of Boulevard and happy that Rachel picked this one out for Fathers Day. Really have high hopes for this one. Expecting at least a 4.25.

Poured a reddish-brown, amber, semi-clear color with 3-to-4 fingers of frothy, khaki head. Lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom of the glass. Excellent foamy lacing. Excellent retention. (Sight - 4.25)

Smelled toffee, oak, bourbon, vanilla, leather, tobacco, caramel, oaked cherries, booziness late and cherry figs. (Smell - 4.50)

Taste wasnt quite as good as the nose, but decent. Got oak, bourbon, leathery tobacco, earthy wood, vanilla, toffee, caramel, dry cherries, figs, hints of tart cherry and dates. (Taste - 4.25)

Medium body. Creamy texture. Average-to-lively carbonation. Long, warming finish. (Feel - 4.50)

Really liked this one. Just good all the way through. (Overall - 4.25)

4.34 96 A

The taste of this one is heaven. The bourbon barrel really brings out the best of this beer. You have a lot going on and I cant even begin to pick out every single thing, but I will try. A rich malt base with caramel, vanilla, brown sugar. Sounds sweet? The barrel aromas step in and balance it out. It has a nice, round, full bodied taste with a long finish where the bourbon barrel notes just wont disappear. I really enjoyed this one.

Bottle at home. Two year old. Has a deep unclear mahogany colour with a creamy beige head. Aroma of oak, dried fruit, heather, red berries and some alcohol and chocolate. Has a silky mouth feel, full-bodied and light bitterness. A complex and very rich ale.

Hazy dark amber pour with small tan head. Aroma of malts, fruits, toffee, vanilla and bourbon. Taste of malts, toffee, dried fruits, vanilla, oak, bourbon and subtle cherries. Full bodied, medium to low carbonation, strong bourbon finish that mellowed at lower temps. A little off balance but enjoyed more closer to room temperature.
@ LIBF 2016. Brown colour, dark fruit, sweet malts, bourbon, vanilla. Well balanced quad, ,not too sweet. Nice.

10cl sample from bottle at the Leuven Innovation Beer Festival II 2016 (16 V 2016). This Bourbon quad fits the top 50 of quadrupel brews and it really has some trump cards. A brown ale with medium carbonation, dirty looking. Spices and bourbon notes cover the flavours, the mouthfeel is very dry, peaty, straw. The taste has a keen bitter sweet balance, making this a lovely, high alcohol drink.

The palate delivers the same, raisins and stewed cherries, caramel, spicy and woody undertones. Not a lot of bourbon presence, surprisingly, but Im thankful for that. A little alcoholic, but a nice sipper.

text: UPDATED: MAY 12, 2015 Flavorful without being too heavy. The barrel aging does show. There are better barrel aged beers but this didn?t disappoint

Aroma very much like Founders Backwoods Bastard. Oak/barrel taste comes thru where it would be hard to know it was a Belgian style Quad. Strong carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 75cl corked. An unclear, dark amber to brown beer with a dense, two-finger light beige head. Some lacings. The aroma has some dried fruits, caramel and a roasted touch. Bourbon notes. Its full-bodied, warming and pleasantly carbonated. The flavor is quite sweet, with caramel maltyness, some nuttyness,and a faint bourbon touch. Lasting finish. Actually a good one, but Im not impressed. The quad part is good, rest is rather ordinary. 150411

Bottle 750ml @ yngwie
Pours hazy dark amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, dried fruits, oak, vanilla and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long warm, dried fruity, oak and vanilla finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

surprisingly smooth - was expecting a heavier alcohol content. Enjoyable, good flavor, and surprising kick

addendum: didnt notice an aroma and please be kind as this is my first review here. Im usually review succinctly on Untappd, so this is new for me.
Flaske mens vi brygger hoe Egdetveit?en: brunlig rav med beige skum. Nydelig og kraftig aroma og smak av sjokolade, kirsebær, vanilje og eik. Balansert bitterhet i ettersmaken.
Shared bottle at Vaaland Bryghus 10.04.15. Hazy dark orange. Pale brown head. Aroma of fermented berries, oak and vanilla. Similar taste, with juice of berries and evident bourbon.

Dark amber with off white head - Good sweet malt aroma with wood and vanilla - Good malt body with dark berries wiih some wood notes and sweet vanilla in the back - Malts, some wood and the sweet vanilla goes into a long finish with some alcohol as well - This was good

Bottle shared with Dan and Nick at home. Snifter pour is deep brown that is hazy with a white head. Some lacing. Aroma is sweet dark fruits, dark candy, slight spice, Belgian yeasts, booze and barrel. The taste was sweet candies, dark fruits like prunes and plums, mild spices, bourbon barrel, caramel, and some vanilla. Full body, chewy. Smooth mouth and slick. Bold finish with flavors and wood. Very nice.

750ml corked bottle pours a cloudy amber color with a generous white head that has nice retention and leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is mild cherries with some chocolate and bourbon notes. Taste is a big malty sweetness with a light hop bitterness finishing with a light alcohol burn. Medium bodied with nice carbonation that tickles the tongue. Overall, I really enjoyed this one as one of my favorite quadruple style ales.

Aged for 2+ years in my basement. Excellent. This is a series to continue as a flagship series, a definite cellar beer. Little bit of debris that transfers to the glass, continuous flavor throughout, strong beer that delivers in spades!

2011 bottle. It poured a hazy golden/orange color with an off-white head. The aroma was of oak, bourbon, vanilla, coconut, some cherry and a hint of dark fruits. The taste was of oak, coconut, vanilla, bourbon and light cherry with caramel malts and dark fruits. The finish was dry and oaky with some booziness. It had a medium body with lots of character. 2011 was a very good year.

Deep brown, wooden colour, Quite a bit of white to slightly tan, foamy head. Head quickly settles, but leaves a thin, white layer on top. Wine, alcohol, bourbon and light cherry nose. Also some wood. Similar flavours, together with raisins, dark fruit, vanilla and some spices. Mostly sweet. Some sourness from the cherries. A bit dry. Medium body. Lively carbonation. A bit too heavy on the bourbon and cherries. Many of the very nice flavours in the original Sixth Glass seems to be lost during the aging process.

750ml split with michcam "I dont do 8 balls any more". Pours a deep Amber with a decent sized white head. Aromas of bourbon barrel, dark fruit, yeast. Lively and light for a beer this big. Gentle barrel character. Solid rew. Would chug again.
75cl bottle. Small light brown head. Clear brown colored. Aroma is oak, caramel, sugar. Taste is very sweet, bourbon, wood.
Flaska från SB 2013 vintage. Smak och doft av fat, bourbon, körsbär, vanilj med toner av russin. Lagom sötma, fruktig, aningen mycket kolsyra, fin beska. Hade kanske tjänat på att stå några år till.

Bottle at Malmø beer festival.Muddy dark orange colour with medium head aroma is fruity of tart cherris raisin and slight yeast even marmalade flavor with vinious mouth feels and sweet warming finish nice smooth finish.
UPDATED: MAR 16, 2015 Very nice. There's obvious bourbon on the nose and palate. I enjoy the complexity. Worth getting

Flaska från SB 2013 vintage. En tydligt bourbon fatlagrad abt/strong ale. Fina vanilj, fat, russin, torkade körsbär och såklart bourbon. Trots lite större alkoholstyrka än den vanliga Sixth glass inte tillräcklig stor kropp för att riktigt hantera bourbonlagringen helt. Men det är en liten reservation mot en annars riktigt bra öl
Bottle at a big tasting (Nörprovning 2015). Bottle from 2013. Fruity and yeasty smell. Yeasty taste with herbs and soap. Overly carbonated. Unbalanced.
Pleasant sweet bourbon on the nose. Fizzy pour, thin head, no lacing. Sweet bourbon flavor. Not really finding much of a typical quad taste only subtle hints. Still a good beer though.

Mixing my two favorite drinks: beer and bourbon; what could go wrong. 

While most bourbon aged beers will attempt to impart a multitude of flavors, this beer does an excellent job at giving off subtle flavors of chocolate, cherry, toffee while preserving the imperial style stout and adding the best of the bourbon barrel (the fruits, honeys and oak). 


Probably the best bourbon barrel stout I've enjoyed in the past year. Too bad winter is almost over.
750 ml. pours a dark brown color with a small white head. Aromas of bourbon, caramel, light cherry. Full bodied, complex, very nice
Pours murky brown with thin head. Smell is bourbon oak and caramel malt. Taste is caramel, oak, bourbon and toffee. Medium body, heavy carb.

Bottle. Moderate aromas of cereal, roasted and caramel for the malts, cooked orange for the hops, dough and broth for the yeast, with hints of smoke, brown sugar, bourbon and milk. Head is small, frothy, light beige, with a spot or two of lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is muddy, medium brown. Flavor starts heavily sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes moderately sweet, acidic and bitter. Palate is medium to full, creamy, with a lively carbonation and a moderately alcoholic. Perfectly balanced Quadrupel with a nice touch of smoke and bourbon.

Pours a deep mahogany with a rich, off-white head. Aromas of butterscotch, toffee, bourbon, and hints of cherry. Smooth flavor with stronger bourbon flavors on the back end. The cherries in this are very subtle, making it one of the better ales brewed with cherries Ive had.

750ml bottle, from Dutchs. Hazy dark brown red color. Finger and a half of off-white head, pretty nice head good retention Looks good overall. Good bits of lace. Nice dark fruit, great bigger vanilla flavor, some caramel, good oak. Moderate to bigger sweet taste, light to moderate bitter, mild bite. Bigger body, smooth, kind of soft crisp lighter carbonation. Mild bite and heat Not uncomfortable, but not magically smooth like the best quads are. Still, a very nice, enjoyable, flavorful American BA quad to sip on, despite being a tad bit harsh.
Bottle shared by Frank. Pours a slightly cloudy amber with minimal beige head. Aroma and taste of wood, booze, yeast, and some spices with good carbonation.

Pours clear coppery amber with a VERY thick buff head. Fruity, malty aroma has a strong overtone of bourbon-infused oak and hints of caramel and cherry. Flavor delights with bourbon, woody, apple, cherry, malty, and shy caramel and vanilla notes - and an alcohol bite like a Doberman pinscher. Firm body has OK fizz, and leaves a bourbon and woody and slightly fruity finish. Smoke that stack!
Bomber, pours an orange brown with some floating yeast. Thin tan head. Bourbon nose mixed with Belgan notes. A strong blend of bourbon, oak and Belgan flavors. long slow finish.

Super super quad cherry plum aroma tight champagne like bubbles bring out oak bourbon and cherry balance. Flavor of wet stems and prune grape like with good balance of alcohol heat. Nice cherry oak finish. Excellent

1 pint, 9.4 oz bottle, poured into a wide-mouth snifter at approximately 45 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a beautiful red-amber, and forms a massive off-white head with a slight orange tint. Excellent head retention, and it leaves lacing on the glass itself as it recedes, to say nothing of the lacing left by the thick ring it eventually collapses into. Tiny bubbles continually stream from the bottom of the glass, joined sporadically by the occasional larger bubble.

Smell: Delightful. Dark fruits and candi sugar erupt from the glass, heavy with plums, slightly soured grapes, and cherries. Theres a faint oaken tinge to the aroma, and vague suggestions of vanilla.

Taste: In an almost exact reversal of the nose, the bourbon barrel strikes first as the beer touches the palate, with heavy notes of vanilla, burnt toffee, char, oak, and boozy heat. Beneath those notes, the candi sugar sweetness takes the center of the rear stage, with the fruit notes off toward the wings and possibly the orchestral pit. The finish brings a slightly sour tone, as cherry and some lingering candi sweetness ride a rush of pure boozy heat. A tiny bit of wooden flavor lingers after the swallow as well.

Mouthfeel: Hot with alcohol, this is also a nigh syrupy beer in consistency, both encouraging sips over swigs.

Overall: This blends the complexity of a good Belgian with the power of a potent bourbon barrel nicely. It drinks a touch hot, but there are few nigh-12% ABV barrel-aged beers that can conceal that - a spot of age might take a bit of the edge off as well. I dont know that I would ever reach for this over a good non-barrel-aged quad, but perhaps trying one with some age on it might change that opinion.

Poured from a bomber into a snifter glass cloudy caramel with a light beige head.
Aroma is fruity booze.
Flavor is banana like ester. Bready. Subtly sweet. Bourbon like a job!
Carbonated more than I prefer in a quad but done very well above average.

A nice quad overall, tasty and very well balanced but a bit one note. Pours a cloudy amber with a thick tan head and a good amount of sediment . Smells of maker's Mark and cherries. Taste is very smooth and creamy, with lots of cherries and a bourbon finish. Not too much complexity in the taste though. Had in the bottle.

Bottle (75 cl) from Systembolaget. Murky chestnut, medium fizzy beige head. Strong barrel and bourbon aroma, some dark sugars and red berries. Medium bodied, meidum carbonation. Semi sweet with low bitterness.

2010 Vintage, Batch 2
From notes. Tasted in early 2013 from a corked and caged 750mL bottle that I purchased at Lush and shared at SvTs house. Pours clear bright auburn with an average tan head that leaves a thin ring of lace. The nose is full of bourbon maple, caramel, toffee, toast, a dry yeasty note, and a just a hint of cherry. The flavor is more funky with more cherry than the nose with the caramel and maple bourbon really the focus. The body is full with lively carbonation and a long funky cherry and lightly sweet bourbon finish.

Darkish orange with a creamy off-white head. Aroma is bourbon, rose, brown sugar, hint of banana. Medium-full bodied, lightly creamy mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a lightly boozy finish. Taste is cherries, honey, banana, caramel.
Bottle - Vintage 2013 - Bourbon and cherry sweetness. Cloudy copper with a white head. Boozy bourbon, cherry and lots of booze. A bit too much barrel and booze now.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 Bottle (750ml $15): Cloudy copper color with white head. Aroma, mostly yeasty, funk smell with some bourbon. Taste has carmel and cherry. Quite a bit or carbonation. medium body.

Dark hazy caramel brown in color... Aroma of caramel, toffee, cherries and oak... Flavor is caramel, oak, nutty malts, and a hint of cherries, notes of bourbon on palate... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 bottle. Best by 08-2016, batch number B14234-1.
This was served in a chalice. 
The appearance was a nice looking hazy dark amber to brown color, shimmered nicely in the light. Half finger-ed white foamy head maintained a nice level-ness and dissipated within about a light thirty seconds leaving a speckled light lacing sticking around the glass. 
The smell started off with a cooked sweet cherry and a sweet to bready spicy clove, good. 
The taste was mainly sweet and added a decent spice to the flavor. Weird but okay sweet to spicy aftertaste leading to a dry finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a fairly decent sipping quality about it. The carbonation seemed appropriately styled and was good for me. 
Overall, I say this was a pretty good quad I could have again.

Shared 750 ml. bottle poured to snifters, showing a murky, brownish amber color, with a frothy layer of off white head foam, and ribbony cling to the lacing. The nose started with alcohol readiness, then a bit of circus peanuts/banana esters, dried fruit, caramel sweetness, and barrel induced vanilla & coconut. Medium+ bodied, with decent carbonation, the taste was similar notes as the aroma, bourbony warmth, light creaminess to the texture, and some dryness on the finish. A bold, tasty, and well designed Quad.
Fairly strong bourbon taste up front with a nice smooth sweet honey finish. One of my favorite Boulevard beers.

On the Seventh Day of Christmas 2014 the beer gods gave to me . . . a bourbon barrel aged quad? It had me at hello. Poured into the Duvel glass for obvious reasons that I just discovered. Pours a murky brown color with light tan foam head. Aroma of dark fruit and loads of cherries. Some yeast mixed in. Sweet caramel taste with dark fruit and nice frothy hop hit. Tons of cherry and then a fading-in vanilla on backend. Some oak spice hits early and then lingers for some time after, but in a way that compliments they sweetness that also lingers. Excellent.

750 bottle thx heather and frank a: bourbon, grappy, caramel, licorice, brown sugar App: hazy brown thick beige head and excellent lacing. T/p: full body with moderate long sweet finish. O: superb. The wood is really present it adds some nice complexity to the brew. Highly recommend.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours deep brown with a cream-colored head. Aroma of bourbon and oak and vanilla, some notes of dark fruits, caramel and toffee and sweet malts, some light notes of chocolate, and some spices. Flavor the same with a nice blend of the quad and the barrels. Smoother texture. If I liked quads as much as I used to, this would be one of my favorite beers.

This beer is a slightly red brown in color and pours with a thick, lasting, creamy head. It has a mild cherry aroma punctuated with vanilla notes. The vanilla becomes much stronger in the flavor and the cherry much more subtle. That slight cherry flavor balances the bourbon bite and flavor really well. A wonderfully done beer.

News flash: Boulevard makes fantastic Belgian-style beers, and the Smokestack Series is amazing. Actually, nothing in that previous sentence was surprising. Fortunately, Bourbon Barrel Quad does pack some surprises. To put it a better way, it answers a unique question. "What would a bourbon barrel aged quad taste like?" Apparently, it tastes like cherries, sweet booze, sugary malt, oak, plus some touches of vanilla and smoke. In other words, it tastes delicious.

Bottle.

A- Cherries, oak, woody, booze, sweet, dark fruits, brown sugar.

A- Reddish color, hazy liquid, tan head.

T- Oak, booze, dark fruits, cherry, slightly sweet, smokey.

P- Full body, average texture, medium carbonation, boozy finish.

O- Pretty darn good as expected with the Smokestack series. Lots of booze and resembles more of a barleywine for me. The cherries are there but the oak and booze really come through. Dont really like the yeast in the glass it makes it look like sand got in my beer but I can get over that.

Bomber from HyVee for Thanksgiving dinner. The aroma is amazing--its bourbon and butter all the way. Flavor is rich with dark fruits and bourbon. Smooth. Surprisingly a little bit on the lighter side, but I can get past it. Worth the price? For special occasions, but not generally.
Hints of bourbon and fruit. Cinnamon, vanilla, molasses, brown sugar. Very boozy, definitely lots of bourbon. The cherry flavor is not very pronounced.
Aromas of coconut, cherry, banana, booze. Hazy brown with a lasting white head. Boozy, fruity, rum notes, bourbon notes. Medium-full bodied.
Floral cherry aroma and some malty bourbon notes. Beige head and murky rust colored body. Bourbon cherry with some juicy banana. Juicy and smooth on the palate.

Just a small hint of cherry on the aroma and the taste. Smooth, malty, darker golden brown, very well balanced beer. 

A bit of bourbon in the finish.

Aroma of cinnamon, bourbon, vanilla, toasted oak, molasses, dark fruits, Belgian candi sugar and fresh apple juice. Appearance is a murky amber/copper. Taste is sweet, fresh fruit juice overtones with notes of cinnamon, molasses, candi sugar, dark fruits, plums, cherries and a big amber malt body. Finish brings big bourbon booze, vanilla, oak and subtle coconut. Overall, very nice and big sweetness with a hint of roasted espresso. Very complex and nice bourbon notes. A rating.

Bomber into a pint glass. Pours a murky medium brown, with a large khaki head that persists and leaves good lacing. Nose is very faint aroma of bourbon and vanilla. Taste is very smooth, with mild vanilla and bourbon notes on the forefront. Very well-balanced, smooth, and tasty. A very nice BB quad. Well-balanced, smooth, not harsh or hot.
Smells of bourbon and sour cherries, taste is overwhelmed by bourbon, much more than most barrel aged beers. Not my favorite, I wanted a quad that tastes like a quad. Still decent enough though.

Draft @ Tapwerks, OKC. Bourbon character aroma, but not cloying. Dark Amber color, thin white head. Nice wood flavor in taste. Cherries noticeable in aftertaste, but not too sweet. Full bodied. Pretty nice beer for a 2014 beer.

Subtle cherry on top of nice bourbon flavor layered into a great Quad. I can't wait to get another bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle. murky brown/amber with small tan head. dark fruits, caramel, oak wood, lightly tart aroma. oak and strong bourbon flavors, butterscotch, cherry fruit, faintly sour. plastic band aid phenols. large bubbled annoying carbonation.  kind of a jumbled mess with an unclear concept.  i dont get it.  not my favorite from the smokestack series.

750 cc from Capones. Pours turbid coppery ruby with fizzy, off-white head. Nose is like a Westy Junior, with layered fruit, caramel malt, cherries, wood, funky yeast, hops, vinous fruit. Tastes dry, earthy and yeasty, with vinous fruit, dehydrated cobwebby esters, wood, hops, This is an exemplary quad.

2014 btl. Excellent head, color, nose, taste, finish. Perfect balance. Sweet, yet not cloying. Subtle cherries, medium bourbon sweetness, mild earthy hops, minimal alcohol present. One of my few perfect ratings. Wonderful beer!

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours clear reddish copper with a big frothy and fizzy goldenish beige head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty, boozy, slightly fruity, slightly estery and tiny phenolic with caramel, biscuits, vanilla fudge, charred wood, toasted coconut, marzipan covered baked pears, raisins, cherries, ripe apples, bourbon, butterscotch hard candy and hay. Taste is sweet, slightly malty, fruity, slightly estery and tiny phenolic with caramel, toffee, cherries, raisins, vanilla hard candy, toasted coconut, hazelnuts, pears, caramelized almonds, apple skins, bourbon alcohol, soil and hay. Mouthfeel is soft, round, slightly fruity tart, slightly boozy, tiny tannic astringent and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, slightly malty and slightly fruity with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, cherries, baked pears, caramelized almonds, charred wood, bourbon alcohol and hay. The cherries really adds to this making it a fun beer. Not too complex as a quad but barrel aging and fruit makes it a treat that is dangerously drinkable for the abv.

Very tasty! Based on the Sixth Glass, which is one my favs .... this guy has been aged in a bourbon barrel with cherries. 

2014 from a bottle. It has nose of burned caramel with a faint essence of sour cherries. Pours a nice chestnut with a light tan head that is tight and persistent. The flavor is amazing. Smooth caramel wrapped candied cherries .... subtle on the cherries. Finishes with a lingering toasted caramel and subtle fizz. 

Well worth a try, if you like the Quad style.

September 9th, 2011 - Boulevard Brewerys Bourbon Barrel Quad was the highlight of my very first local beer tasting here in San Diego. A fellow craft beer fan in my graduate student housing complex said sent out a call and craft beer aficionados flocked to the site. Murky, deep and a healthy and hale red-orange, even in the glass this brew stands out amongst the crowd. The subtler smells were crowded out by the raucous atmosphere, but keen notes of cherry and dry barrel aging wood were sharp and poignant, even as they blended with the aromas of other open beers on the tabletop. Mild cherry flavors lead the charge on the palate, delivering a nice, lingering acidic edge and concluding with a deep, overripe sweet cherry aftertaste. Notably for a beer this reliant on cherry flavors, there was absolutely no hint of that cough medicine flavor that plagues beers of this flavor persuasion. A bourbon burn accompanies a generally heavy alcohol push, giving this beer a powerful but elegant touch of fruits and barrel aging that I find compelling.
